section.name: Harvest Server Installation and Configuration
section.p: This document describes installation and configuration of Harvest Server.
Download latest binary release (ZIP file) and extract it to some directory, such as /opt/big-data-harvest-1.0.0
Run harvest-server in bin directory without any parameters to print usage information.
section.source:
Usage: harvest-server <options>
Commands: -c <config file> Start Harvest server -V, --version Print Harvest version
Optional parameters: -l <file> Log file. Default is /tmp/harvest/harvest.log -v <level> Logger verbosity: DEBUG / ALL, INFO (default), WARN, ERROR
section.p: Example configuration file is located in the installation directory, (/conf/harvest-server.cfg). The following parameters are available.

tr.td: Message broker type. Currently only "RabbitMQ" is supported. We can add more types in future releases.
RabbitMQ "host:port" tuples (one tuple per line). For example, "localhost:5672".
Optional parameter. Elasticsearch authentication file. For example, "/etc/pds-registry/auth.cfg"
Embedded web server port. Default value is 8005.
Optional parameter. Store original PDS labels (XML) as BLOBs. Default value is "true".
Optional parameter. Store PDS labels in JSON format as BLOBs. Default value is "true".
Optional parameter. Extract basic file information and calculate MD5 hashes of all data files referenced in a PDS label.
